title: Oil prices rise on expectations of more OPEC output cuts
text: Oil prices rose on Friday, supported by expectations of more production cuts by OPEC amid fears the U.S.-China trade row could lead to a global slowdown, curbing demand for crude.

title: Trade war escalation nudges U.S. closer to recession: Reuters poll
text: The recent escalation in the U.S.-China trade war has brought forward the next U.S.

title: Asia shares trade higher as investors await Chinese inflation numbers, Japan GDP beats expectations
text: Investors are keeping a close watch on China's inflation rate for the month of July, due to be released around 9:30 a.m. HK/SIN on Friday.

title: Cramer: Debunks 'false fears' that caused market sell off this week
text: "It's clear that selling stocks into the teeth of the sell-off earlier this week was a big mistake," Jim Cramer says.

title: S&P 500 posts biggest daily gain in two months as rebound continues
text: The S&P 500 registered its largest one-day percentage gain in about two months on Thursday, with technology shares providing the biggest boost as equities continued to rebound along with bond yields.

title: U.S. SEC proposes rule changes to company legal, risk factor disclosures
text: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Thursday voted to propose rule changes to the way companies describe business, legal, and risk factors in their regulatory disclosures.

title: Is this market in a bull run?
text: Hennessy Funds CIO Neil Hennessy discusses why he thinks the stocks are in a bull market.

title: Stock Market Today: Bears and Bulls Have Both Won — Now What?

title: Today's market bounce-back not surprising, we will see consolidation: Barclay's Lewis
text: Mike Lewis, Barclay's managing director of U.S. equity cash trading, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss today's market action.

title: Dow Jones Today: China Provides a Calming Influence
text: The world's second-largest economy said exports jumped 3.3% last month while economists were expecting a 2% drop.

title: Here's what CME Group CEO Terry Duffy has to say about the volatile bond market
text: Terry Duffy, chairman and CEO of the CME Group, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss volatility in the bond markets.

title: 10-25% Tariffs May Not Be So Bad. Still, Buy the Big Banks, Says One Expert
text:
There are tons of unknowns in the financial market right now. 
Between the threat of an added 10% to 25% tariff on Chinese apparel, toys and electronics coming into the U.S., whether the U.S. will see more interest rate cuts, and therefore how much upside the stock market has for the medium-term, investors need to manage risk with precision.

title: This Should Be A Boon To Crypto Prices In The Long Run
text: Crypto networks are built to be resistant to attack by any outsider. Including governments.

title: Investment advisor discusses market volatility and investing amid trade tensions
text: KeyAdvisors Group's Eddie Ghabour discusses why he is becoming cautious amid U.S. trade tensions with China.

title: JP Morgan's top stock market analysts say hold on tight and buy this market dip
text: For investors fearful of more trade-war bombshells, the worst is over and it's go time, according to J.P. Morgan.

title: Oil rises more than 2% on firm yuan, expectations of more OPEC cuts
text: Oil jumped more than 2% on Thursday on expectations that falling prices could lead to production cuts, coupled with a steadying of the yuan currency after a week of turmoil spurred by an escalation in U.S.-China trade tensions.

title: Currency may be next front in US-China trade war
text: Some investors fear a currency war between the US and China is coming after Beijing allowed the Yuan to fall below a key symbolic level and President Donald Trump labeled China as a currency manipulator. CNN's Julia Chatterley explains.

title: Fed did not cause slowdown: Investment expert
text: Ernie Celia of Bryn Mawr Trust and David Katz of Matrix join CNBC's "Power Lunch" team to break down the day's market gains and what it means for the trading session.

title: Analysts are hesitant to change stock calls during trade war: 'It can all change with a tweet'
text: Pricing in a trade war is hard enough, but it's being made even more challenging by having to account for Trump's Twitter feed.

title: The yield curve everyone's worried about is inches away from flashing a recession signal
text: The dramatic scramble for U.S. debt has pushed a bond market recession indicator inches away from the warning zone.

title: Rate cuts send bad signal to market, says Greenwich Wealth's Janjigian
text: Vahan Janjigian of Greenwich Wealth Management, Matt Maley of Miller Tabak & Co., and CNBC's Steve Liesman join 'The Exchange' to discuss the state of global economies and whether the Fed's decision to raise interest rates was a mistake.

title: Here's why oil stocks have fallen
text: Roberto Friedlander of Seaport Global joins 'The Exchange' to discuss why energy stocks are falling and if the selling is overdone.

title: There are still investing opportunities ahead, says portfolio manager
text: Margaret Reid, Union Bank's Private Bank senior portfolio manager, joins "The Fast Money Halftime Report" team to discuss the mid-day markets amid concerns of an escalating U.S.-China trade war and a looming currency war.

title: Santelli Exchange: The impact of volatility on markets
text: CNBC's Rick Santelli discusses the current market volatility and bond yields with Jonathan Fine of Goldman Sachs.

title: Carl Icahn is not sure rate cuts can fix problems facing the economy, says it can't be that easy
text: “I don’t think just lowering rates is the answer... if it were that easy, you’d never have these cycles,” Icahn said.

title: U.S. small-cap stocks under renewed threat from tariffs
text: Last week's announcement of more U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods may have undermined the prospects for small-cap stocks to rebound this year, even after a brief respite from the Federal Reserve's recent interest-rate cut.

title: Deep Dive: 20 companies, including Amazon and Chipotle, that are getting more profitable as sales improve
text: Second-quarter earnings season isn’t turning out to be as bad as analysts expected.

title: Trump Again Calls For 'Substantial Fed Cuts' In Series Of Tweets
text: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (NYSE: SPY) is down more than 2% so far in the month of August after President Donald Trump threatened to impose new 10% tariffs on $300 billion worth of Chinese imports not already covered under the existing tariffs.

title: Ray Dalio is bullish on China and thinks now is the time to invest

title: Wharton's Jeremy Siegel: Trump needs a trade deal with China to get reelected
text: "I think that's his only reelection strategy that will work for him" to sure up the economy and stock market, says Siegel.

title: Wall Street on the rise for third day after upbeat data
text: U.S. stocks surged on Thursday as better-than-expected domestic and Chinese data as well as a firming yuan offered some relief to investors alarmed by a week of blow and counterblow between Beijing and Washington over trade.

title: President Trump criticizes Fed, strong dollar in series of tweets
text: CNBC's Eamon Javers discusses a series of tweets by President Trump that criticize the Fed's interest rate cuts and the strength of the dollar with CNBC's "Squawk on the Street.

title: Jim Cramer: Before You Look for Recession, Search for Bargains

title: Indian automaker Mahindra considers second US plant in Michigan
text: Indian automaker Mahindra and Mahindra said on Thursday it plans to open a plant in Flint, Michigan, to make vehicles including mail delivery trucks for the US market, a move that could create up to 2,000 jobs.

title: Dan Fuss: 'Enormous' investment opportunity if trade deal is reached
text: Dan Fuss, Loomis Sayles vice chairman, joins "Squawk on the Street" to discuss the escalating U.S.-China trade war and what to expect if a deal is reached.

title: Big Oil Still Gets That Wall Street Money
text: As the price of WTI lingers in the low $50 range, investors in American shale operations must consider if they want to stay in that game.

title: Chinese trade data calms volatile global markets
text: Stronger-than-expected Chinese export data helped push global stock markets higher on Thursday following a volatile week that had investors scrambling for safety due to fears of a worldwide economic pullback.

title: All 11 sectors of the S&P 500 trade in positive territory a day after the biggest comeback of 2019
text: All 11 main sectors of the S&P 500 index SPX, +1.05% were trading firmly in positive territory on Thursday, a day after the index staged its biggest turnaround of the year, erasing intraday losses of as much as 2%, to end higher.

title: Earnings growth will be slower than anticipated, says strategist
text: Seth Carpenter, UBS chief U.S. economist, and David Kelly, JP Morgan chief global strategist, discuss the markets and earnings with CNBC's "Squawk on the Street"

text: The regulatory framework for Bitcoin and other digital assets continues to evolve globally, albeit slowly.

title: Trump rips strong dollar, says the Fed has 'called it wrong at every step of the way'
text: He made his support of a weak dollar official, saying ithat the he is disappointed in the strong currency while blaming the Fed.

title: Buffett And Masa: Two Sides Of The Same Coin?
text: Warren Buffett, the Oracle of Omaha and Masa Son, the goofy venture capitalist heading SoftBank, may appear to be polar opposites, but under the surface, they have much in common.

title: Markets bounce back as hope rises for a second China truce

title: Scaramucci to Trump: CEOs holding back spending because China tariffs are too unpredictable
text: Corporate leaders want clarity from President Trump on the long-term plan to deal with China, says ex-White House aide Anthony Scaramucci.

title: Distressed Investing Slowed by 'Too Good' Economy: Oaktree's Marks
text: Howard Marks, co-founder and co-chairman at Oaktree Capital, discusses how the U.S. economy is impacting distressed investing. He speaks with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: More U.S. Companies Seen Leaving China After September
text: Some 40% told AmCham Shanghai that they  were moving, or considering it back in May. Imagine now.

title: Janus Henderson's Maroutsos Says 10-Year Bond Yield Can Fall to 1%
text: Nick Maroutsos, co-head of global bonds at Janus Henderson, discusses the trend lower in bond yields, the easing of global monetary policy, and the state of the U.S. economy. He speaks on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."
